com.apriori.apt.testing

Class TestJavaFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.apt.testing.TestJavaFileManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, javax.tools.JavaFileManager, javax.tools.OptionChecker

    public class TestJavaFileManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.tools.JavaFileManager
    An in-memory file manager. This can be used, for example, to run compilation and annotation processor tasks from a unit test.

    Client code will instantiate a TestJavaFileManager, optionally providing a parent ClassLoader (for use when creating class loaders). Then the code defines all necessary input files using createFileObject or createJavaFileObject (each of these methods is overloaded to easily define either text file contents or binary file contents). Finally, the new file manager can be used for new compilation tasks.

    FileObjects returned by this class are all in-memory. Changes made to these file contents by OutputStreams and Writers are only seen after they've been flushed. Closing streams automatically flushes them. All open streams can also be flushed using the file manager's flush() method.

    This file manager cannot be used after it has been closed. Methods that impact the in-memory file system will throw IOExceptions.

    This file manager does not have any supported options.

        public TestJavaFileManager(javax.tools.JavaFileManager platformFileManager)

        Parameters:
        platformFileManager - the platform file manager (see JavaCompiler.getStandardFileManager(javax.tools.DiagnosticListener<? super javax.tools.JavaFileObject>, java.util.Locale, java.nio.charset.Charset))

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the file system. Resetting the file system deletes all files and invalidates any open streams for writing files. After a reset, input files will need to be re-seeded using createFileObject or createJavaFileObject

      • createJavaFileObject

        public TestJavaFileObject createJavaFileObject(javax.tools.JavaFileManager.Location location,
                                               java.lang.String className,
                                               javax.tools.JavaFileObject.Kind kind,
                                               java.lang.String contents)
        Creates a new java file that has text contents in the in-memory file system.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the file
        className - the name of the class
        kind - the kind of file
        contents - the contents of the new file
        Returns:
        the newly created file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified file already exists or the specified destination is the StandardLocation.PLATFORM_CLASS_PATH
        See Also:
        createJavaFileObject(JavaFileManager.Location, String, JavaFileObject.Kind, byte[])
